title: MySQLFROM_DAYS()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLFROM_DAYS()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return a date from a numeric representation of the day:
SELECT FROM_DAYS(685467);

Definition and Usage
The FROM_DAYS() function returns a date from a numeric datevalue.
The FROM_DAYS() function is to be used only with dates within the Gregorian 
calendar.
Note:
This function is the opposite of the
TO_DAYS()
function.
Syntax
FROM_DAYS(
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required.  The numeric day to convert to a date
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return a date from a numeric representation of the day:
SELECT FROM_DAYS(780500);

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLFROM_DAYS()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLFROM_DAYS()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples.
